subject: It says: "Flunitrazepam readily dissolves, and once in solution, is colourless, odourless, and tasteless.

scientists, although not all, believe this process is linked to high
blood pressure, or hypertension, which in turn is linked to a greater
risk of coronary heart disease and stroke.
"Banking" involves attaching the blood vessels of the amputated body
part to healthy blood vessels surgically exposed at another site - in
the case of the Samurai victim, the arm. This can lead to blockages in
the vessels, preventing oxygen from getting through to the tissues, and
causing severe pain and damage to the organs.
Most schizophrenic individuals are not violent; more typically, they
prefer to withdraw and be left alone. Though the illness usually begins

on the body (but usually at the site of infection) this is not always
the case. How is schizophrenia treated? Although news and entertainment
media tend to link mental illness and criminal violence, studies show
that mentally ill people are no more prone to violence than the general
public.

rate, so that the cells can go without their usual supply of nutrient
and oxygen while detached from the blood supply.

secretly for some time before they ask for help, often because of fear
and shame. The infection can be cured by antibiotics. There is no cure
for sickle cell anaemia.

effects last for about eight hours.

in order to remove their inhibitions. It also plays a central role in
